result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrina M Medrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.03(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for 23 days.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to comply with any order in the family case.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katrina M Medrano

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Kari at P & P - defendant has paid in full and has complied with everything.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 12 months

1:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Agent Deb Duel present in court.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if not paid, Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court informs defendant regarding right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:12 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from Atty Privat dated 08/27/2015 in regards to sentence credit

11:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to amended count of criminal contempt of court.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  State moves to amend to criminal contempt of court.  Court grants the amendment.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on amended count 1.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months

CONDITIONS:

Defendant is to comply with any order in the family case.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Court costs.
Extradition fees - $1,550.40

Sentence credit - Counsel to submit something in writing to the court.

Court adjourned at 11:52 a.m.
Status hearing at 08-18-2015 11:00 am

1:49 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs to get an offer from the DA.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 18, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m.
Status hearing at 07-07-2015 01:30 pm
Status hearing at 06-02-2015 01:30 pm

10:10 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - still waiting for Discovery.  Statement by ADA.  Court will set for status hearing on June 2, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.

Status hearing at 04-21-2015 10:00 am

3:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on April 21, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:50 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat

1:19 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $2,500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing in a couple of weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.
